item.title: Lisp extensions
item.description: Indentation # I would like my property lists to align not like this GPL-3.0-only (:prefix-map rab/git-map :prefix "C-c g") but like this: GPL-3.0-only (:prefix-map rab/git-map :prefix "C-c g") The answer is almost verbatim from Emacs Stack Exchange, but changed to my namespace. I also applied the “bonus,” because my primary itch is use-package bindings. GPL-3.0-only (defun rab/lisp-calculate-indent (&optional parse-start) "Add better indentation for quoted and backquoted lists." ;; This line because `calculate-lisp-indent-last-sexp` was defined with `defvar` ;; with it's value ommited, marking it special and only defining it locally.

item.title: Taxonomy tag cloud
item.description: This is the taxonomy list page, which is rendered as a tag cloud. We use it for categories and tags. Terms are rendered in a font proportional to the logarithm of its page count.

item.title: Header template
item.description: Our header is straightforward semantic HTML, with a <h1>, <p>, <nav>, etc. It establishes the brand, and my brand is to be a complete dweeb. Therefore, we’re going to abuse CSS to render it as an Emacs Lisp definition.
